required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Suprachoroidal Triamcinolone Acetonide in Harada's Retinal Detachment
clinical_study.official_title: Suprachoroidal Triamcinolone Acetonide Injection A Novel Therapy for Serous Retinal Detachment in Vogt-Koyanagi Harada's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Suprachoroidal injection, a novel technique for delivering ocular therapies, may facilitate targeted therapeutic delivery to the choroidal and retinal structures than intravitreal injection

detailed_description.textblock: Suprachoroidal injection, a novel technique for delivering ocular therapies, may facilitate targeted therapeutic delivery to the choroidal and retinal structures than intravitreal injection. Yielding high levels of corticosteroid in the retinal and choroidal layers which was detectable for more than 3 months with limited exposure in the anterior segment. Triamcinolone acetonide is a synthetic corticosteroid formulated as an injectable suspension and has been evaluated in a number of trials to be 7.5 fold more potent anti-inflammatory than cortisone. Triamcinolone acetonide enhance tight junctions between endothelial cells thus reducing vessel leakage. It also has an angiostatic action by inhibition of vascular endothelial growth factor and has a useful effect on many inflammatory retinal diseases. The recommended dose of Triamcinolone acetonide injection is 4 mg/0.1 mL which was administrated in this study. The aim of this study was to assess the efficacy of suprachoroidal Triamcinolone acetonide injection (SCTA) as adjunctive therapy in the management of Vogt-Koyanagi Harada's (VKH) multiple serous retinal detachment (RD) and evaluate best corrected visual acuity (BCVA), intraocular pressure(IOP) and central foveal thickness (CFT) by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) in patients diagnosed as VKH at ophthalmology clinic, Benha University, EGYPT and Ebsar eye center, Benha, EGYPT.

primary_outcome.description: Changes in vision from baseline upto 6 months follow up

secondary_outcome.measure: Central Foveal Thickness measured by Optical Coherence Tomography
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in CFT during 6 months after injection

other_outcome.measure: Intraocular pressure measured by Goldmann applanation tonometry
other_outcome.description: Changes in IOP during 6 months follow up

arm_group.description: Suprachoroidal Trimacinolone Acetonide injection 4mg/0.1ml, single dose, follow up for 6 months.
Non-injected eyes on systemic steroids (standard treatment) and follow up for 6 months

intervention.intervention_name: Suprachoroidal Triamcinolone acetonide injection for serous retinal detachment in VKH disease
intervention.description: Suprachoroidal steroid injection for management of serous retinal detachment in VKH disease
intervention.other_name: SCTA for Exudative RD in VKH disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients diagnosed as VKH serous retinal detachment in the acute phase whom BCVA is not improving after 2 weeks from starting systemic steroids.
Exclusion Criteria:
- recent intraocular surgery.
- patients refuse to participate in the study.
- media opacity and other causes of serous retinal detachment than VKH.

facility.name: Ophthalmology department,Benha University and Ebsar eye center,Benha,EGYPT
